description: really like the spreadsheet style approach, great for mass tagging
summary: my favorite tagging app on linux,

description:
The two functions:
-take info from filename to write tag
-take info from tag to rename file

Are highly confusing and icons aren't intuitive. What is more, the tools have label tips that are incorrect. They are exchanged.

And the worst: Who needs to open a program to delete files? I've lost a couple of albums due to Puddletag has the options 'Del' and 'Del without confirmation', referring to files, not the tag. But user could believe these tools are only for the tag, and to learn they aren't after loosing data. 

Icon tools are not intuitive, bro.
summary: it swaps buttons and remove files

description:
Reviewer Stregoika below talked about losing albums. I also ran into this problem just now. 

I used Puddletag to rename the album fields of a folder's worth of mp3s, and left it open while doing other tasks, which admittedly was a mistake.

I used Ubuntu's file manager to move the parent folder to a new location., 

Once I returned to Puddletag it notified me that the folder was empty, so I navigated to the new location to double check the changes I made held. 

On exiting Puddletag , it deleted the entire folder which wasn't even recoverable via the file manager's trashcan. 

Luckily the parent folder, containg my new D&D character I am building, was left intact.

A very close call.
summary: Avoid. Deletes files randomly. Needs some serious debugging

description: Note: This particular snap packaging of Puddletag does not give permission to the applicatino to access files on external drives.
summary: Can't access files on external drives

description: I have been using puddletag for years. Very reliable and fast. Allows me to view my files differently. Highly recomened from a longtime radio broadcaster who requires software that works.

For me (and possibly quite a few others) this is a totally usless piece of software as it doesn't access anything that isn't on your boot drive. 
So if you boot from a quick SSD but store your music on a large internal HDD - forget it!
I come from mp3tag by Florian Heidenreich and this app replaces it very well for most of my usecases.

Crashes when you save saying:
  raise TypeError("%s has to be bytes" % self.name)
TypeError: data has to be bytes
Aborted (core dumped)

Ubuntu 22.04: 
Application crashes when Extended Tags are used to add album art. Artwork window opens in protected mode, cannot add. 
Unfortunatly this is not the useful app I used to know.

Liked the app, but it cannot access most folders by default thanks to snap. Makes UX absolutely terrible. Even if you somehow can change that, I don't want to have to look up how - flatpaks has flatseal at least, know of nothing similar for snap.
Crashed when trying to open artwork. Would love to give it a better star rating but found the app clunky, slow to open and the fact it crashes means it is unusable.
I don't even know where to start. Running MP3Tag in wine is awsome.
select the music u want to add the artwork and see how smooth it crashes

wasn't available last time I checked. No it is back. Great. Used it for years. Simple, easy to understand and does what it should do. Man what a relieve that it works now again... Tried easytag for a while. Didn't work well.
summary: Great to have you back (Ubunt 20.4 LTS)

description: Einfach, genial und damit einfach genial! Mehr braucht man nicht für mp3-Tags!

Hi, I like the program in general but somehow puddletag keeps deleting my music directory after I modify the tags for an album and go to save my changes. I saved my songs in the /home/music/ directory and it randomly deltes the music directory and moves the files to the /home/user/ directory instead.
Ich habe unter Windows immer MP3 Tag benutzt das Programm ist fast genauso
Me ha sido de mucha ayuda para organizar las canciones en mi playlist local y online.
summary: La aplicación es genial. La recomiendo

description: En Ubuntu 22.04 no accede a la musica almacenada en una memoria USB

- No puedo acceder a los discos externos desde Puddletag.
- Al intentar insertar una foto en el archivo correspondiente, se cierra el programa.
Sistema operativo: Kubuntu 23.04, he probado con otros y me pasa lo mismo.
Does not work anymore (ubuntu 22.04)
deberia mejorar eso
summary: ubuntu 22.04 no accede a medios extraibles

description:
- Lent au démarrage, SNAP !
- N'accède pas aux volumes externes "naturellement". Il faut lui mettre tout le chemin d'accès manuellement. Exemple pour téléphone : "/run/user/1000/gvfs/mtp:host=SAMSUNG_XXXXXXX_XXXXXXX_XXXXXXXXXXX/Stockage interne/Music/Samsung"
Très pratique, non !?
- Plante, plante, plante.
Impossible d'aller dans repertoire disque externe.

L'application serait très bien si l'accès aux media USB était possible.
Là manifestement l'accès reste uterdit pour une raison que j'ignore.
summary: joli mais impossible d'accéder aux média USB !! pourquoi ???

description:
Je ne mets que 3 étoiles parce que c'est installé (et exécuté) par snap qui alourdit le lancement.
J'avais une version précédente installée par un ppa qui était beaucoup plus rapide.
Néanmoins ça fait le job...
Fonctionne aussi sur les supports externes

Fait très bien ce qu'on est en droit d'attendre d'un éditeur de tags.
Le meilleur sur linux de mon point de vue, et de loin.
Très bonne application, sauf qu'elle n'accède pas aux média USB. Si Dan qui affirme le contraire connaît une manip à faire pour y accéder, ça serait intéressant qu'il explique comment !

C'est un bon outil très pratique, avec des fonctionnalités très efficaces face à certains concurrents, mais qui plante malheureusement très souvent (affichage de la pochette, sélection en masse, tags détaillés) depuis sa dernière mise à jour me semble-t-il, sur Ubuntu 22.04 LTS.
Fool crach kjuto7iyv';o97
